exit_code.description: Error occurred. Please check Tool Standard Error

param.label: Learning rate
param.help: float >= 0

param.label: decay
param.help: Learning rate decay over each update.

param.label: @ARGUMENT@
param.help: (l1, l2). l1/l2: float; L1/l2 regularization factor. (0., 0.) is equivalent to `None`
Integer or list of integers. axis along which to calculate weight norms
the maximum norm for the incoming weights.
the minimum norm for the incoming weights.
the maximum norm for the incoming weights.
rate for enforcing the constraint.

param.label: units
param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

expand.help: For example: use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Fraction of the input units to drop.

expand.help: For example: noise_shape=None, seed=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: The ordering of the dimensions in the inputs.
A shape tuple (integer), not including the batch size.For instance, `shape=(32,)`
An optional string name for the layer. Unique. autogenerated if it isn't provided.
The data type expected by the input
Tuple of integers. Does not include the batch axis.
Tuple of integers. Permutation pattern, does not include the samples dimension. Indexing starts at 1. For instance, (2, 1) permutes the first and second dimension of the input.
repetition factor
The function to be evaluated. Only lambda function is supported!
L1 regularization factor (positive float).
L2 regularization factor (positive float).
Masks a sequence by using a mask value to skip timesteps.
Fraction of the input units to drop.
Fraction of the input units to drop.

expand.help: For example: data_format=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Fraction of the input units to drop.

expand.help: For example: data_format=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of a single integer, specifying the length of the 1D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=1, padding='valid', data_format='channels_last', dilation_rate=1, use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of 2 integers, specifying the height and width of the 2D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=(1, 1), padding='valid', data_format=None, dilation_rate=(1, 1), use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of a single integer, specifying the length of the 1D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=1, padding='valid', data_format='channels_last', dilation_rate=1, depth_multiplier=1, use_bias=True, depthwise_initializer='glorot_uniform', pointwise_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', depthwise_regularizer=None, pointwise_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, depthwise_constraint=None, pointwise_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of 2 integers, specifying the height and width of the 2D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=(1, 1), padding='valid', data_format=None, dilation_rate=(1, 1), depth_multiplier=1, use_bias=True, depthwise_initializer='glorot_uniform', pointwise_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', depthwise_regularizer=None, pointwise_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, depthwise_constraint=None, pointwise_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: An integer or tuple/list of 2 integers, specifying the height and width of the 2D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=(1, 1), padding='valid', depth_multiplier=1, data_format=None, use_bias=True, depthwise_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', depthwise_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, depthwise_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of 2 integers, specifying the height and width of the 2D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=(1, 1), padding='valid', output_padding=None, data_format=None, dilation_rate=(1, 1), use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of 3 integers, specifying the depth, height and width of the 3D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=(1, 1, 1), padding='valid', data_format=None, dilation_rate=(1, 1, 1), use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of 3 integers, specifying the depth, height and width of the 3D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=(1, 1, 1), padding='valid', output_padding=None, data_format=None, activation=None, use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: int or tuple of int (length 2) How many units should be trimmed off at the beginning and end of the cropping dimension (axis 1). If a single int is provided, the same value will be used for both.
int, or tuple of 2 ints, or tuple of 2 tuples of 2 ints.

expand.help: For example: data_format=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: int, or tuple of 3 ints, or tuple of 3 tuples of 2 ints.

expand.help: For example: data_format=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: integer. Upsampling factor.
int, or tuple of 2 integers. The upsampling factors for rows and columns.

expand.help: For example: data_format=None, interpolation='nearest'. Leave blank for default.

param.help: int, or tuple of 3 integers. The upsampling factors for dim1, dim2 and dim3.

expand.help: For example: data_format=None, interpolation='nearest'. Leave blank for default.

param.help: int, or tuple of int (length 2)
int, or tuple of 2 ints, or tuple of 2 tuples of 2 ints.

expand.help: For example: data_format=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: int, or tuple of 3 ints, or tuple of 3 tuples of 2 ints.

expand.help: For example: data_format=None. Leave blank for default.

param.name: pool_size
param.help: Integer, size of the max pooling windows.

param.name: strides
param.help: Integer, or None. Factor by which to downscale. E.g. 2 will halve the input. If None, it will default to pool_size.

expand.help: For example: padding='valid', data_format='channels_last'. Leave blank for default.

param.name: pool_size
param.help: integer or tuple of 2 integers, factors by which to downscale (vertical, horizontal)

param.name: strides
param.help: Integer, tuple of 2 integers, or None. Strides values. If None, it will default to pool_size.

expand.help: For example: padding='valid', data_format='channels_last'. Leave blank for default.

param.name: pool_size
param.help: tuple of 3 integers, factors by which to downscale (dim1, dim2, dim3). (2, 2, 2) will halve the size of the 3D input in each dimension.

param.name: strides
param.help: tuple of 3 integers, or None. If None, it will default to pool_size.

expand.help: For example: padding='valid', data_format='channels_last'. Leave blank for default.

param.name: pool_size
param.help: Integer, size of the max pooling windows.

param.name: strides
param.help: Integer, or None. Factor by which to downscale. E.g. 2 will halve the input. If None, it will default to pool_size.

expand.help: For example: padding='valid', data_format='channels_last'. Leave blank for default.

param.name: pool_size
param.help: integer or tuple of 2 integers, factors by which to downscale (vertical, horizontal)

param.name: strides
param.help: Integer, tuple of 2 integers, or None. Strides values. If None, it will default to pool_size.

expand.help: For example: padding='valid', data_format='channels_last'. Leave blank for default.

param.name: pool_size
param.help: tuple of 3 integers, factors by which to downscale (dim1, dim2, dim3). (2, 2, 2) will halve the size of the 3D input in each dimension.

param.name: strides
param.help: tuple of 3 integers, or None. If None, it will default to pool_size.

expand.help: For example: padding='valid', data_format='channels_last'. Leave blank for default.

param.help: The ordering of the dimensions in the inputs.
param.option: channels_last - inputs with shape (batch, steps, channels)
channels_first - inputs with shape (batch, channels, steps)

param.help: The ordering of the dimensions in the inputs.
param.option: channels_last - inputs with shape (batch, height, width, channels)
channels_first - inputs with shape (batch, channels, height, width)

param.help: The ordering of the dimensions in the inputs.
param.option: channels_last - inputs with shape (batch, spatial_dim1, spatial_dim2, spatial_dim3, channels)
channels_first - inputs with shape (batch, channels, spatial_dim1, spatial_dim2, spatial_dim3)

channels_first - inputs with shape (batch, channels, steps)

channels_first - inputs with shape (batch, channels, height, width)

param.option: channels_last - inputs with shape (batch, spatial_dim1, spatial_dim2, spatial_dim3, channels)
channels_first - inputs with shape (batch, channels, spatial_dim1, spatial_dim2, spatial_dim3)

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of a single integer, specifying the length of the 1D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=1, padding='valid', data_format=None, use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of 2 integers, specifying the height and width of the 2D convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=(1, 1), padding='valid', data_format=None, use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

expand.help: For example: activation='tanh', use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, dropout=0.0, recurrent_dropout=0.0, return_sequences=False, return_state=False, go_backwards=False, stateful=False, unroll=False. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

expand.help: For example: activation='tanh', recurrent_activation='hard_sigmoid', use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, dropout=0.0, recurrent_dropout=0.0, implementation=1, return_sequences=False, return_state=False, go_backwards=False, stateful=False, unroll=False, reset_after=False. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

expand.help: For example: activation='tanh', recurrent_activation='hard_sigmoid', use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', unit_forget_bias=True, kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, dropout=0.0, recurrent_dropout=0.0, implementation=1, return_sequences=False, return_state=False, go_backwards=False, stateful=False, unroll=False. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of n integers, specifying the dimensions of the convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=(1, 1), padding='valid', data_format=None, dilation_rate=(1, 1), activation='tanh', recurrent_activation='hard_sigmoid', use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', unit_forget_bias=True, kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, return_sequences=False, go_backwards=False, stateful=False, dropout=0.0, recurrent_dropout=0.0. Leave blank for default.

param.help: the dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
An integer or tuple/list of n integers, specifying the dimensions of the convolution window.

expand.help: For example: strides=(1, 1), padding='valid', data_format=None, dilation_rate=(1, 1), activation='tanh', recurrent_activation='hard_sigmoid', use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', unit_forget_bias=True, kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, dropout=0.0, recurrent_dropout=0.0. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

expand.help: For example: activation='tanh', use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, dropout=0.0, recurrent_dropout=0.0. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

expand.help: For example: activation='tanh', recurrent_activation='hard_sigmoid', use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, dropout=0.0, recurrent_dropout=0.0, implementation=1, reset_after=False. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

expand.help: For example: activation='tanh', recurrent_activation='hard_sigmoid', use_bias=True, kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', unit_forget_bias=True, kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, dropout=0.0, recurrent_dropout=0.0, implementation=1. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

expand.help: For example: kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, return_sequences=False, return_state=False, stateful=False. Leave blank for default.

param.help: Positive integer, dimensionality of the output space.

expand.help: For example: kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform', recurrent_initializer='orthogonal', bias_initializer='zeros', unit_forget_bias=True, kernel_regularizer=None, recurrent_regularizer=None, bias_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, kernel_constraint=None, recurrent_constraint=None, bias_constraint=None, return_sequences=False, return_state=False, stateful=False. Leave blank for default.

param.help: int > 0. Size of the vocabulary, i.e. maximum integer index + 1.
int >= 0. Dimension of the dense embedding.

expand.help: For example: embeddings_initializer='uniform', embeddings_regularizer=None, activity_regularizer=None, embeddings_constraint=None, mask_zero=False, input_length=None. Leave blank for default.

param.name: merging_layers
param.label: Type the layer index numbers in a list
param.help: List of numbers

expand.help: Integer or tuple of integers, axis or axes along which to take the dot product.

param.label: Whether to L2-normalize samples along the dot product axis before taking the dot product?

param.help: float >= 0. Negative slope coefficient.
the axes along which to share learnable parameters for the activation function. E.g. [1, 2]
scale for the negative factor.
float >= 0. Threshold location of activation.
Integer, axis along which the softmax normalization is applied.
float >= 0. Maximum activation value.
float >= 0. Negative slope coefficient.
float. Threshold value for thresholded activation.

expand.help: For example: axis=-1, momentum=0.99, epsilon=0.001, center=True, scale=True, beta_initializer='zeros', gamma_initializer='ones', moving_mean_initializer='zeros', moving_variance_initializer='ones', beta_regularizer=None, gamma_regularizer=None, beta_constraint=None, gamma_constraint=None. Leave blank for default.

param.help: float, standard deviation of the noise distribution.
drop probability, (as with `Dropout`). The multiplicative noise will have standard deviation `sqrt(rate / (1 - rate))`

param.name: inbound_nodes
param.label: Type the index number of input layer
param.help: Find the index number at the left top corner of layer configuration block

param.label: Type in key words arguments if different from the default

param.name: callback_type
param.label: Choose a callback
param.option: EarlyStopping -- Stop training when a monitored quantity has stopped improving
TerminateOnNaN -- Terminates training when a NaN loss is encountered.
ReduceLROnPlateau -- Reduce learning rate when a metric has stopped improving
CSVLogger -- Streams epoch results to a csv file

param.help: Minimum change in the monitored quantity to qualify as an improvement.
Number of epochs with no improvement after which training will be stopped.
Baseline value for the monitored quantity to reach. Training will stop if the model doesn't show improvement over the baseline.
Whether to restore model weights from the epoch with the best value of the monitored quantity
Factor by which the learning rate will be reduced. new_lr = lr * factor
Number of epochs with no improvement after which learning rate will be reduced.
Threshold for measuring the new optimum, to only focus on significant changes.
Number of epochs to wait before resuming normal operation after lr has been reduced.
Lower bound on the learning rate.
Quantity to be monitored.

param.option: auto -- the direction is automatically inferred from the name of the monitored quantity
min -- training will stop when the quantity monitored has stopped decreasing
max -- training will stop when the quantity monitored has stopped increasing

param.help: Integer. Sequence length or number of bases.
Whether to shuffle the data between epochs.
Integer, random seed for data shuffling
Tabix-indexed list of regions from which we should not output sequences
Query the tabix-indexed file for a region of length.
Threshold values to determine target value.
Random seed number, to control the sample position in each invertal.

param.name: optimizer_type
param.label: Select an optimizer
param.option: Adamax - A variant of Adam based on the infinity norm

param.label: Momentum
param.help: float >= 0. Parameter that accelerates SGD in the relevant direction and dampens oscillations.

param.label: Decay
param.help: float >= 0. Learning rate decay over each update.

param.label: rho
param.help: float >= 0.

param.label: rho
param.help: float >= 0.

param.label: beta_1
param.help: float, 0 < beta < 1. Generally close to 1.

param.label: beta_2
param.help: float, 0 < beta < 1. Generally close to 1.

param.label: Whether to apply the AMSGrad variant?
param.help: Refer to paper `On the Convergence of Adam and Beyond`

param.label: beta_1
param.help: float, 0 < beta < 1. Generally close to 1.

param.label: beta_2
param.help: float, 0 < beta < 1. Generally close to 1.

param.label: beta_1
param.help: float, 0 < beta < 1. Generally close to 1.

param.label: beta_2
param.help: float, 0 < beta < 1. Generally close to 1.

param.label: schedule_decay
param.help: float, 0 < beta < 1.

param.name: batch_size
param.label: batch_size
param.help: Integer or blank for 32

param.name: steps_per_epoch
param.label: steps_per_epoch
param.help: The number of steps (batches of samples) before declaring one epoch finished and starting the next epoch. The default None is equal to the number of samples in your dataset divided by the batch size, or 1 if that cannot be determined.

param.name: validation_steps
param.label: validation_steps
param.help: Default None. Total number of steps (batches of samples) to validate before stopping.
